quote.msg: 啱啱起身未得閒睇INTC份er，陣間睇完再打個summary

replies.msg: 留名

INTC: GAAP operating margin 18.8%, net income 3.4B, 就咁睇好似好差咁，但其實係之前畀人罰咗2B嗰度，所以你睇返Restructuring and other charges 2,209M，除咗gross margin低咗，最主要就喺呢一筆一次性嘅罰款（當然INTC上訴緊，所以隨時有可能revise，不過呢啲專利官司都無咁快）

業務：data centric business閪冧，就咁睇最主要係嚟自AMD同ARM架構嘅競爭同埋需求真係減弱咗

PC業務就表現唔錯，主要係嚟自notebook極多嘅demand同埋一啲wifi同thunderbolt嘅業務，同時都因為AMD嘅產能問題令到INTC可以保住個market share

IOT業務都幾好，同時Mobileye（其中一個我睇好INTC嘅理由）隨住汽車業嘅復甦，revenue爆升48%由254M升到377M，呢個行業仲有好多潛力可以發掘，值得期待

最後PGA（Programmable Solutions Group）revenue同income都略微下降，但我長遠都睇好FPGA嘅發展
今年cashflow應該會少咗，主要係income嘅下降加上Capex由14B加到20B（應該主要係foundary業務嘅set up（係arizona起個兩間新廠））

總結：份er點都係唔靚㗎啦，好在就新CEO效應仍然生效，嚟緊都係要睇下點樣面臨住AMD，NVDA等其他對手守住data centre嘅市場，再加上製程嘅發展，最後再睇下其他業務可唔可以有發展支持翻個revenue（無錯mobileye同Habana我就係講緊你地）

Silicon Laboratories (NASDAQ:SLAB) reported quarterly earnings of $0.91 per share which beat the analyst consensus estimate of $0.75 by 21.33 %.
This is a 31.88% increase over earnings of $0.69 per share from the same period last year.
The company reported quarterly sales of $255.50 million which beat the analyst consensus estimate of $242.11 million by 5.53%.
This is a 18.91 % increase over sales of $214.88 million the same period last year.

STMicroelectronics (NYSE:STM): Q1 GAAP EPS of $0.39 in-line.
Revenue of $3.02B (+35.4% Y/Y) beats by $100M.

Gross margin 39.0%; Operating margin 14.6%

Business outlook at the mid-point: Q2 net revenues of $2.9B and gross margin of 39.5%.

“We will drive the Company based on a plan for FY21 revenues of $12.1 billion, plus or minus $150 million, a year-over-year increase of 18.4% at the mid-point. This growth is expected to be driven by strong dynamics in all end markets we address and our engaged customer programs," commented Jean-Marc Chery, President & CEO.

三星電子首季盈利升逾40%　料晶片業務將有改善

南韓三星電子預計，今季晶片業務盈利將大幅改善，但移動業務預計會下跌，因為全球晶片短缺對業務有不同影響。三星電子首季盈利近9.4萬億韓元，按年升約45%，是2018年首季以來最好表現，亦好過公司之前預計，主要受惠手機業務盈利升66%，至4.4萬億韓元。三星電子表示，在美國德州的晶片廠，首季因冬季寒潮而關閉後，至今已全面恢復生產，但部份業務今季仍受之前生產中斷的影響。

Samsung:

The Memory Business saw a slight profit decline due to a downward trend in NAND prices and initial costs associated with ramping up new lines, despite overall decent demand backed by server and mobile products.


DRAM:
Demand for mobile stayed solid despite the weak seasonality due to releases of new 5G smartphones

Demand from PC remained strong

Likely to stay robust thanks to the expanding 5G market and related growth in content-per-box and

sever demand will continue to be strong backed by solid demand for cloud applications.

PC demand will stay solid as educational laptops enter peak seasonality

DRAM prices are expected to continue the upward trend through the second half of the year

strengthen technology competitiveness by applying EUV on multiple layers of the 14-nm DRAM




NAND:

Demand from mobile was robustly supported by strong smartphone sales along with rising demand and content-per-box.

Server SSD saw growth in demand compared to the previous quarter thanks to the base effect of weak demand in the previous quarter as major data center companies resumed storage investments.

Address the increase in demand for high-capacity SSD with 8TB or more

Accelerating migration to the industry’s only single-stack based 128-layer 6th generation 512Gb V-NAND

Revenue of $1.8B (+26.8% Y/Y) beats by $50M.

Q4 2021 Guidance: Revenue expected to be in the range of $1.76 - $1.96B, vs. consensus of $1.78B; Adj. gross margin between 61% to 63%; GAAP EPS between $3.20 to $4.08; Non-GAAP EPS of $3.47 to $4.35, vs. consensus of $3.67.

Skyworks Solutions (NASDAQ:SWKS): Q2 Non-GAAP EPS of $2.37 beats by $0.02; GAAP EPS of $1.95 misses by $0.08.

Revenue of $1.17B (+52.7% Y/Y) beats by $20M.

“Based on robust demand for connectivity solutions in mobile and broad markets, we expect continued momentum and year-over-year growth into the June quarter,” said Kris Sennesael, senior vice president and chief financial officer of Skyworks. “Specifically, in the third fiscal quarter of 2021, we anticipate revenue to be between $1.075 billion and $1.125 billion with non-GAAP diluted earnings per share of $2.13 at the midpoint of our revenue range, representing revenue growth of 49% and non-GAAP diluted earnings per share growth of 70%, compared to the third fiscal quarter of 2020.”Revenue consensus of $1.07B, EPS consensus of $2.09 consensus.

連登半導體指數 (LISI) 5月份成分股

WASHINGTON—April 30, 2021—The Semiconductor Industry Association (SIA) today announced worldwide sales of semiconductors totaled $123.1 billion during the first quarter of 2021, an increase of 3.6% over the previous quarter and 17.8% more than the first quarter of 2020. Global sales for the month of March 2021 were $41.0 billion, an increase of 3.7% compared to the previous month. SIA represents 98% of the U.S. semiconductor industry by revenue and nearly two-thirds of non-U.S. chip firms.

“Global semiconductor sales remained strong during the first quarter of 2021, topping sales from the previous quarter and substantially outpacing the total from the first quarter of last year,” said John Neuffer, SIA president and CEO. “Year-to-year and month-to-month sales in March increased across all major regional markets, and demand grew across a range of product categories.”

Regionally, year-to-year sales increased across all markets: China (25.6%), Asia Pacific/All Other (19.6%), Japan (13.0%), the Americas (9.2%), and Europe (8.7%). Month-to-month sales increased in Europe (5.8% percent), China (5.3%), Asia Pacific/All Other (3.4%), Japan (3.1%), and the Americas (0.6%).
